title_short: (21710) Bollullos Par del Condado - Unnamed Road

title: (21710) Bollullos Par del Condado - Unnamed Road
title_short: (21710) Bollullos Par del Condado - Unnamed Road
description: For dear heart people who want to get to know the simple life on a self-sufficient finca with their camper/VW/Bulli size. If you want, you will always find something to do in the Campo and if you like it, there is nothing to stop you sharing meals on the veranda. For the rest, there is a lot of privacy for guests. When electricity is required, the generator must be fed with petrol. The property is completely fenced. My dog is a very large galgo, another family member is a donkey mare and two young cats have been living here since June. All animals are very loving and well tolerated. I look forward to dear guests. If you are not subscribed to park4night, my contact details will not be displayed, but you can still arrive spontaneously and without prior notice until sunset. Most of the time I'm at home. Everything chilled. Kind regards, Sabine

title: (21700) La Palma del Condado - 2 Poligono Plan Parcial 8 Industrial
title_short: (21700) La Palma del Condado - 2 Poligono Plan Parcial 8 Industrial
description: Due to the proximity to the motorway and industrial area, of course, not exactly a quiet place - but I still spent a pleasant night here.

title: (21710) Bollullos Par del Condado -
description: Two parking spaces available on a creative permaculture farm in the countryside. Super suitable for people who appreciate nature and tranquility. Access is easily passable. In nearby Bollullos there are bars, restaurants and all shops. Please keep dogs on a leash.

title: (21700) La Palma del Condado - Calle Hinojos
title_short: (21700) La Palma del Condado - Calle Hinojos
description: We are a family that recently acquired the land to create a Permaculture project, aware of the care of mother earth. We are living OFF THE GRID means living without connections to public utilities like sewer, water, and electrical lines, we are self-sufficient and our water comes from the well and electricity from our little solar system. We are aware of the waste we produce and we kindly ask you to bring your rubbish and place it in the rubbish bins at the entrance of the village as the grey/black water of your sink/toilet. We kindly ask that the use of cleaning products of any kind be biodegradable. It is important that if you are going to use our shower you take this into account, since the drains go directly to the floor. The place is located in the beautiful La Palma del Condado, a town known for the quality of its wines. This is a private property. The plot is approximately 7000 m2, fenced all around, very close to the road, in a very quiet rural area. A composting toilet and greenhouse shower nearing completion. Possibility of long stay. Hours: ENTRY until 20:00 OUT until 12:00. To make your vacation complete, you can ask about our yoga classes and our organic garden products. Come meet us. ✨☺️ Thank you very much for choosing us.✨

title: (21700) La Palma del Condado - 32 Calle Bollullos del Condado
title_short: (21700) La Palma del Condado - 32 Calle Bollullos del Condado

description: New FREE area for motorhomes, with an area for loading water and for unloading gray and black water, area with lighting, near supermarket, 2 minutes walk from the center. 72hrs max. There is a nearby park with very nice plants and trees, with swings for children. Next to the area there are baskets and an area to play petanque. Beautiful and charming town, which is well worth the visit of its old town, wineries, ... Perfect geographical location, between Huelva and Seville, between the beach and the Sierra, near the highway. There are 6 spaces, but you can also park outside at the fairgrounds, so there is room for many. There is a market on Fridays, but you can park as the area is outside the market area. Closed only the second half of September for the local fair.

Our finca is easily accessible and is located 4 km from the village of Rociana del Condado, 20 km from El Rocio and 20 minutes from the beaches of Mátalascaña. We want to provide maximum facilities to our visitors although we are in our infancy and we are working to ensure a family atmosphere. We speak French, Spanish and English. Welcome everyone.

The Via Verde starts from here and allows you to follow this river for about 7 km of gravel track, passable on foot but also by bike (mountain bike or VTC). On the opposite bank, there are also footpaths which also seem to be used by trial bikes. I think this place must be very crowded on weekends. We went there on a Monday evening, alone, and in absolute calm.

title: (21730) Almonte -

Please keep the place clean and pick up some trash, otherwise the place will be closed! There are no trash cans. Now and then a few cars drive by. (Around June 22-27 there is a big event “saca de las yeguas” where the wild horses are rounded up here, you can't park here!!)

title: (21840) Niebla - HU-3106

title: (21891) Chucena - 6 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Picnic area with playground next to the highway in Chucena. There is a tap with drinking water, container, litter bins, picnic tables, barbecues. Plenty of shade. Ideal for a stop. In front of a hermitage. Nice walk to the town where there are shops and bars. I do not recommend sleeping because of the noise from the road and highway. Good wine in the town.

name: Global Tribe Biodynamic Ecovillage
title: (21730) Global Tribe Biodynamic Ecovillage
description:
'Welcome to our biodynamic farm and eco-camping! We are a small eco-living project located on the Costa de la Luz next to the picturesque protected natural park of Doñana. Everything we use on our farm and everything we grow is certified 100% organic. Also, all our by-products of daily life go back to our fertilizers, our building materials, our little chicken coop. We are a self-sufficient farm, recycling materials, giving it a creative new use in life. Welcome to biodynamic life. It's about being green and living in peace with the environment. But at the end of the day, we're just a bunch of big-hearted people doing our best to live sustainably and having a lot of fun doing it! As a guest with us, you can stay in our private teepees, bungalows, (2-4 pax), pitch your own tent, park your motorhome/RV on our premises, or rent all indoor wooden accommodation for your event (30pax), bio-bathrooms compost and solar powered indoor and outdoor showers (use only biodegradable toiletries) We have plenty of relaxation areas, sofas, zen areas, hammocks, dining tables, desks, volleyball court and sunset spots... Lunch and dinner all organic freshly picked from the garden. 
Welcome!

title: (21740) Hinojos - A-474
description: Beautiful and peaceful park with barbecues and tables

title: (21740) Hinojos - 35 Calle Feria
description: Pinares de Hinojos, very quiet location, surrounded by nature, near a bar, several supermarkets, a municipal swimming pool, ideal for hiking and cycling, 40 minutes from the beach, 30 minutes from Seville and 1 hour from the Sierra de Huelva, located in the Doñana Natural Park. Without water service to fill and empty the cassettes, but 5 minutes from the gas station. Camping forbidden

name: Camping Huttopia Parque de Doñana
title: (21740) Camping Huttopia Parque de Doñana
description:
"Welcome to Huttopia Parque de Doñana, in the heart of Andalusia. Here you can discover unique and varied landscapes, including dunes, beaches, forests and extensive marshlands. Located in the middle of the Andalusian provinces of Huelva, Seville and Cadiz and in the heart of the Doñana National Park, this campsite is in the largest nature reserve in Europe, a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.
Whether you want to spend your holiday between the forest and the sea, under the radiant Andalusian sun or on one of the spacious pitches with your own tent, camper van or caravan, Huttopia Parque de Doñana offers you a wealth of natural beauty.
You can also stay in one of the new and fully equipped “ready-to-camp” accommodations, such as the Roulotte or the Canadienne tent. The rental accommodations are located in a car-free zone on the campsite and surrounded by shady pine trees.
Start your day with a delicious breakfast, as you can order fresh bread, croissants and other treats every morning. After an eventful day, you can relax on the terrace, eat an ice cream or enjoy specialities from the region. In summer, freshly baked pizza from the stone oven is also on offer."

title: (21620) Candón - Calle la Jara n1

Can only be done by small vehicles and especially 4x4 or cross-over. There, you will be alone and without any waste around you. Nature +++

I point out this location because I consider it a safe area, since in the town in front of Mercadona they broke the glass on the back of the van. And another van had its locks forced in the area. My intention is for you to know that vans in the area have a sweet tooth and if you have to park, it's better in front of the barracks.

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar -

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar -
description: Beautiful lake that you can swim in. Very quiet Access by a small bumpy road.

title: (41800) Sanlúcar la Mayor - 1 Calle Sevillanas
description: Super laundry, very friendly owner who even helps in German :-)

title: (21007) Huelva - 24 Solar PAU4 la Alqueria
description: Very large Decathlon car park, located in a polygon. Very quiet area, it has some wooden tables to eat.

title: (21007) Huelva - Calle del Jamon de Huelva
title_short: (21007) Huelva - Calle del Jamon de Huelva
description: Road bar, with showers. Friendly attention although the food leaves something to be desired. It is in a commercial area where you can find a Decathlon.

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar -
description: Beautiful place in the middle of nature. There are numerous dirt roads accessible for any type of vehicle. Don't make my yard dirty.

title: (21647) El Pozuelo - Dolmen n4
description: Great place on the path to visit the dolmens. Accessible with small vans. Serves as a parking spot for visitors during the day. I haven‘t stayed during the night. Not many even spots, mainly uneven. Amazing view. Phone service full on.

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar -
description: Esplanade in nature next to a hermitage. Sheep from time to time. Quiet but some dirt.

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar - SE-530
description: For a night and bathe the dogs impeccable

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar - SE-530
description: At the bottom of the picnic area on the waterfront parking lot. Coming from aznalcollar 1st path on the right before the picnic area. Quiet during the week and crowded on weekends. Night possible and tolerated. Superb view and 20 minutes walk from the village. Barbecue allowed. Please leave the premises clean there are 2 large bins. Thank you

title: (21007) Huelva - 19D Finca la Alquería
description: Service station with very clean public bathroom and shower for 2 euros and if you refuel free. It has a parking lot behind that in the morning gives the shade, perhaps a bit noisy in the morning but if you are one of those who wake up early you don't even notice. Very friendly and very attentive at the gas station a 10 for them

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar -
description: Gas, without Cepsa ID 27.50 butane incl deposit (10 euros)

title: (41870) Aznalcóllar - SE-530
description: A spot on top of a hill with great view over the lake. Big spot with many flat places. Nice sunset! Shade from the trees. Possibility to swim in the lake if you go down or cross to the other side. Garbage bins present. The police passed during the night but left us. (Downside: until midnight many cars came by, stayed for a while and then moved again. They did not bother us, but it was a bit strange and therefore not very calm.)

title: (21600) Valverde del Camino - 1A Sector Ue-11 Huerta Pérdida
title_short: (21600) Valverde del Camino - 1A Sector Ue-11 Huerta Pérdida
description: Place on the outskirts of Valverde del Camino in an old industrial estate, a spacious and flat place to spend the night, with the possibility of accessing the Greenway of the water mills for cycling

title: (21647) El Pozuelo - Unnamed road
description:
The road from El Pozuelo is VERY BAD, it is broken (very large holes), it is narrow, it is steep and with rain it may be impassable. Dogs, walkers cross paths, and a cyclist or motorcycle may suddenly appear. It is a HARD dirt road.

It can be done with a motorhome, ours measures more than 7 meters. A cyclist told us that from Berrocal the road is a little better, but maybe it's not in Google.

The place is super quiet to sleep, good for seeing the stars, hiking, seeing dolmens, looking for geocaches and taking bike or motorcycle rides. Saturday morning was filled with hikers, motorcycle riders, and cyclists.

title: (21647) Berrocal - H9026
description: Parking for 2 motorhomes by the river, along a quiet little road, which leads to Berrocal.

name: Camping Doñana Mazagón
title: (21820) Camping Doñana Mazagón
description: Very large campsite on a long sandy beach with a large swimming pool area. Out of season, all pitches cost the same price, otherwise the pitches under the pines and the partially concreted "CP" pitches for mobile homes are more expensive. All pitches with electricity (1200 W) and water. Some of the awnings are only 2.2 meters high and the terrain is partly sandy. Clear separation of the plots, partly with hedges. Evacuation of gray water at the old car wash in front of the entrance. All-you-can-eat lunch and dinner buffet. WLAN at all seats, access data available at reception (on request). swimming pool basin.

title: (21730) Almonte - A-494
description: Place where you can perch and bring your dogs. The beach of Cuesta Maneli.

title: (21800) Caserío Marzagón -
description: Quite big parking, a little bit crowded during summer day, yet almost completely empty during night. Hardened road to the parking and from parking to the ocean beach.

title: (21800) Moguer - 17 Poblado Forestal de Mazagón
description: Spectacular place! Quiet and with access to a natural beach trail. 10 min walk, easy. Few people, dogs are allowed for not being official access.

title: (21800) Moguer - A-494
description: Very large free parking, 5 minutes from the beach. Fresh water between the BBQ places. Not allowed to stay overnight as it’s in a nature reserve.

title: (21130) Mazagón - 358 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Day parking managed by the Junta de Andalucía near the beach of the Parador de Mazagón. it has tables and shades. there is a bar nearby.

title: (21600) Valverde del Camino - 4 Calle Fuenteheridos
description: Very large parking to visit the town. Do not worry.

title: (21130) Huelva - 359 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Very nice parking lot next to the National Parador. Picnic area with tables, barbecues and fountains. It is forbidden to camp. This place of nature is really very pleasant, do not miss a walk on the beach along the cliffs.

title: (21600) Valverde del Camino - 23 Carretera Zalamea
description: Camper area very well located to visit the village, very quiet and I recommend making a meal in the restaurant Casa address this right in the same area. Very dump village with the motorcycle Enduro, a paradise to enjoy this sport.

title: (21130) Moguer - 1 Solar Camping Fontanilla Playa
description: Parking in the middle of nature next to the beach Poor internet in a number of places. Danger! Very high risk of getting stuck!!!

title: (21130) Moguer - 53B Avenida Pintor Miguel Ballesta Maqueda
title_short: (21130) Moguer - 53B Avenida Pintor Miguel Ballesta Maqueda
description: We spent the night without any problem, you have the sunset right in front of you. Along the path (track) that leads to this point there are several entrances to the beach where there were more vans and AC. Be careful, the last few meters are sandy and you can get stuck.

title: (21730) Almonte - Carretera Carril del Abalari
description: A beautiful Natural Parque with excellent visitor facilities. It is designed for bird watching. Gates are locked at 10pm and you are required to leave beforehand.

title: (21647) El Pozuelo - 23 Diseminado Pozuelo
description: Wonderful place with a hiking route to the Dolmens el Pozuelo next to the old train station

title: (21130) Palos de la Frontera - 53 Calle Pintor Miguel Ballesta
title_short: (21130) Palos de la Frontera - 53 Calle Pintor Miguel Ballesta
description:
Direct access to the beach, maybe 5 or 6 places. Some light from an upper street. Access road is hard terrain so no problem. Nearby a family bar, the owners live here.
No services at all. Mazagón the nearest village as a nice Supermarket with fresh fish in the morning and fresh bread is only 3 kms away. You also have a Camping Park 1km away.

title: (41806) Umbrete - 1 Plaza Presidente Rafael Escuredo
description: The real photo for this place is the Last one. Potable water. Emptying and filling services. Ideal for the night. 4 minutes from the highway. Large parking lot on well leveled asphalt near to Sports City with public pool, spa and bar. You must pay for pools and every other services. The parking lot is quiet. Friend of the common motorhome. city council having knowledge of the fourth instruction and other laws on motorhomes. Welcome campers are a quiet and safe place where you can hear owls and owls at night. Rural village with good inns, supermarkets, bakeries and heritage. Do not forget to visit the basilica church and the archbishop's palace. Umbrete is a town of vineyards and table olives. In hardware stores, they sell liquid for toilet and camping chemicals.

name: Camping Playa de Mazagon
title: (21130) Camping Playa de Mazagon
description: Moguer, 19A Avenida Pintor Miguel Ballesta Maqueda. Camping Playa de Mazagon. C / Cuesta de la Barca, s / n, 21130 Mazagón, Huelva, Spain. With a converted van. Sandy pitches but sea view. In my opinion a bit expensive for the quality of the service. A large campsite on top of a cliff overlooking the beach and the entrance to the port of Huelva. Very sandy so we were asked to park on access roads which was fine out of season. I can't imagine how it would be if it was raining.....

description: Quiet place to spend the night

title: (21130) Moguer - 1 Calle Ruiseñor
description: Place to spend the night

title: (41800) Sanlúcar la Mayor - A-477
description: Quiet place next to the road directly on a long-distance hiking trail. Ideal for hiking, running and mountain biking. We were here for 2 days, perfect for our dogs.

description: Finca located in a young forest of cork oaks and pine forests. Ecotourism, hiking and biking trails. Close to town with emptying. Very quiet and safe place. Call before arriving. Thanks

description: Water available on the left side, small connector and good power

title: (21810) Palos de la Frontera - 108 Calle Cádiz
title_short: (21810) Palos de la Frontera - 108 Calle Cádiz
description: Marina parking. During the week and in low season it is totally empty. The other car parks have signs that prohibit the parking of motorhomes.

title: (21600) Valverde del Camino - Unnamed Road

title: (21007) Huelva - 9 Solar PP4 Vistalegre
description: Good site and good area. Surrounded by Casitas. Lots of parking, bright and with a shopping center next door. Quiet and no noise during the week. We were only one day.

title: (21007) Huelva - 18 Calle Barbados
description: Good place to go to the mall (Primark, Burger King, 100 montaditos, Carrefour) or for a night, parking with some shade, quiet street. Bathrooms in the Shopping Center (150m).

title: (21007) Huelva - s/n Avenida de las Fuerzas Armadas
title_short: (21007) Huelva - s/n Avenida de las Fuerzas Armadas

title: (41807) Espartinas - 1903 Calle Camino de Loreto
description: Parking at a monastery with a church. Quiet and partially illuminated at night. In the evening until late at night (depending on the day of the week) young people meet and party with loud music from the cars. A lot of trash.

title: (21800) Moguer - 32 Solar Suelo Sup Mazagon
description: Parking in an urbanization still unfinished. A lot of space, on one side of the field and on the other beach. Very calm. There are only a few houses. 5 minutes walk from the beach. Coming from Mazagon, not on the sandy road that is usually in poor condition for motorhomes

title: (41150) Poblado de Alfonso XIII - Unnamed Road

title_short: (41150) Poblado de Alfonso XIII - La Puebla del Río

description: Repsol gas station with tap and very good water pressure

description: Propane gas bottle at Repsol gas station. You can change Spanish bottled here.

name: Servicios Fred Olsen & Baleària
title: (21810) Servicios Fred Olsen & Baleària
description: Free parking, next to the access to Fred Olsen, Ferry Naviera Armas and Balearia.

title: (21760) Matalascañas - Playa de Matalascañas
description: Nice 4x4 only spot

title: (21004) Huelva - 1 Calle Alcalde Antonio Segovia
description: It is across the road. There is a lot of parking space. I slept two nights here and there were no problem. For a car up to 5m no problem at all, my car is 7m and it was a bit difficult to park but I made it occupying a bit more space. Over the night there is no much traffic so no much noise

title: (21005) Huelva - 1D Avenida de Diego Morón
description: Parking next to the hermitage of the Virgen de la Cinta. The passing of cars starts early. A short walk from the center.

title: (21003) Huelva - 19 Calle Valverde del Camino
description: Unofficial free parking under the bridge. It's usually quite during the night and it's only 5 minutes away walking from the centre. Close to supermarkets, bakeries and many other services and right in front of a park. Ideal for people with dogs.

title: (21810) La Rábida -
description: Bird view spot to a small but cozy lagoon. It's near a big road but you're well secluded, lonely, and no one can see you. It has a brick shed cut in half but in good condition (2022). Place to spend the night protected from rain and wind, and moderately cold.

title: (21005) Huelva - 3 Transversal Santa Marta,avda.de Trans.1
description: Descampado de tierra behind a parking lot. We have spent the night parked next to the fence of the farm (beware! Do not block the doors). At first it is bad at first sight, but it is well lit and we have spent the night very quiet. It seems a very quiet neighborhood.

title: (21005) Huelva - 43 Avenida Manuel Siurot
description: Mainland square with stunning views of the swamp.

title: (21730) Almonte - 7 Sector I
description: Great place just 2 minutes from the beach parking lot (where we parked during the day) which can be noisy as adjacent restaurants. This place is behind the very safe local police station. Level and silent floor. We slept here 3 nights at the end of October, very quiet nights and fun beach days. On Thursdays there's market so it is prohibited to park.

title: (21003) Huelva - 28 Vía Paisajista
description: It's just a parking lot, very dusty and dirty but it's free and is somewhat close to the center

title: (21730) Matalascañas - 7 Sector A
description: Paid parking with many places, quiet, with bars nearby, pharmacy, etc. Some noise at night with cars around.

title: (21730) Almonte - Unnamed Road
description: Seems a nice, unofficial spot where campers stay the night on top of a cliff with great view. The beach is easily accessible next to a nice cafe-restaurant called Heidi Bananas. Police checks, but does not bother the campers.

title: (21647) Monte Sorromero -
description: Lonely, dead quiet spot right next to an abandoned mine and railway graveyard. Not the cleanest place but it has its charm if that's your stuff. The dirt road to get there wasn't difficult at all. ATTENTION for vans no problem. Not suitable for mobile homes over 6 meters !!

title: (21819) La Rábida - 109 Urbanizacion Rabida Urbanizacion
description: Shaded ground, had a quiet night with our van

title: (21819) La Rábida - 102 Urbanizacion Rabida Urbanizacion
description: Parking near the ships of Christopher Columbus. No prohibition sign. Quiet, but in the evening there are mosquitoes.

title: (21760) Matalascañas -
description: We have slept one night here, there were other motorhomes staying overnight when we arrived. The access has some potholes, but nothing important. Path next to the beach and a lighthouse, quite quiet and little traffic. No services but there are rubbish bins along the way. Access to the beach in some sections, others fenced.

title: (21819) La Rábida - Carretera Palos Rábida
description: Pine area with lots of shade, near public toilets, very quiet area to spend the night several nights.

title: (21760) Almonte - 97 Parque Nacional
description: Free parking near local police and school, low noise, easy access, no services

title: (21760) Matalascañas - 34B Sector A
description: Public parking on the beachfront. Very quiet area at this time of year (Easter)

title: (21819) La Rábida - Carretera Huelva-Palos de la Frontera
title_short: (21819) La Rábida - Carretera Huelva-Palos de la Frontera
description: This is free open parking with free water fountain. Feels safe and recovered from wind in bad weather compare to staying next to the sea.

title: (21004) Huelva - 4 Calle San Andrés
description: Clean&Go self-service laundry

title: (21819) La Rábida - 110 Urbanizacion Rabida Urbanizacion
description: Parking right outside the door of the botanical garden. It is open until 21:00 and costs no entrance fee. Very clean toilet. Opens at 10:00 in the morning. The parking lot offers meadow, bushes, sheltered parking spaces. At night one or the other car driving by.

title: (21819) Palos de la Frontera - 107 Urbanizacion Rabida Urbanizacion
title_short: (21819) Palos de la Frontera - 107 Urbanizacion Rabida Urbanizacion
description: Very quiet place there is a retired man living perpetually in a caravan and the bar across the street are very nice, they have told me that the police sometimes pass but that they do not give a fine, it is only to ask for identification

title: (41807) Espartinas - 1B Camino Mejina
description: Perfectly paved public car park, with numerous parking spaces.

title: (21819) Palos de la Frontera - 105 Zona Residencial Santa María
title_short: (21819) Palos de la Frontera - 105 Zona Residencial Santa María
description: This place is at the end of the road right next to the nice gangplank in a roundabout. Me and 3 other cars spent the night there. You can come with a van and cars. It's too small for motorhomes. Amazing view when the sun goes down. All spaces are top row ;) Toilets on the hill. Weak Wifi from the shipmuseum

title: (21002) Huelva - 65 Paseo Independencia
description: Bloomest self-service laundry, next to the pedestrian crossing, has 7kg, 9kg and 15kg washers and large dryers. It also has a reading and book exchange corner.

title: (21500) Gibraleón - 11 Calle Real Escuela Andaluza de Arte Ecuestre
title_short: (21500) Gibraleón - 11 Calle Real Escuela Andaluza de Arte Ecuestre
description: Municipal car park with supply and disposal at no cost. It's right behind the police station. Fenced in, an unlocked sliding roller shutter closes the space. Tapas bars in the nearby local area. Max. vehicle length 7 m, since the maneuvering area is limited by the fence when parking.

address.street: 11 Calle Real Escuela Andaluza de Arte Ecuestre

title: (21001) Huelva - 4 Calle Rascón
description: Laundromat in a side street of the pedestrian zone

title: (21500) Gibraleón - 10 Plaza España

title_short: () Huelva - Dique de Contención de Arenas Príncipe Juan Carlos I

title: (21650) El Campillo -
description: Small flat parking lot for 3/4 vans next to Lake Zumajo. Beautiful views, hikes, swimming and kayaking available. Asphalted road but in bad condition, bottlenecks and a small bridge to cross. ONLY FOR converted vans max 6 meters. Attention: really only for small vehicles! Very difficult access.

title: (21650) El Zumajo - Unnamed Road
description: Not officially, but a great way to rest with luck.
